explains: adj. 长命的；历时长久的；持久的；长期存在的；经久耐用的

sentences.en: Everyone in my family is exceptionally long-lived.
sentences.cn: 我们家每个人都特别长寿。

sentences.en: The flowers may only last a day but the plants are long-lived.
sentences.cn: 这些花也许只开一天，但植物本身却很长寿。

sentences.en: Natural gas and coal—also fossil fuels—have similarly seen price declines that look to be long-lived.
sentences.cn: 天然气和煤炭——还有化石燃料——也出现了类似的长期价格下跌。
